com.rohitsood.urlybird.server
Class DatabaseNetworkServerImpl

java.lang.Object
  java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
          java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
              com.rohitsood.urlybird.server.DatabaseNetworkServerImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
DatabaseNetworkServer, java.rmi.Remote, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.server.Unreferenced
public class DatabaseNetworkServerImpl
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements DatabaseNetworkServer, java.rmi.server.Unreferenced

This is the implementation of the DatabaseNetworkServer. A new instance is created for every client request based on the client's VMID. Instantiates a Data object using the VMID of the client. Interacts with the database directly by delegating all calls to it. When the client disconnects, all locks held by that client are released.

Version:
1.4
Author:
Rohit Sood
See Also:
Serialized Form

public boolean book(java.lang.String recId,
                    java.lang.String maxOccupancy,
                    java.lang.String customerId)
             throws RecordNotFoundException,
                    ValidationException
Description copied from interface: DatabaseNetworkServer
Books a room for the customer. Validation is made based on the current system date, customer id and max occupancy.

Specified by:
book in interface DatabaseNetworkServer
Parameters:
recId - The record id of the room to be booked.
maxOccupancy - The expected number of guests.
customerId - The customer id of the customer for whom this room is requested.
Returns:
true if the room was booked successfully.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - If the record does not exist.
ValidationException - If the room is not available or the validation failerd.

unreferenced

public void unreferenced()
Called when the client terminates the session and disconnects from the server. All database locks held by the client are released. And a garbage collection is suggested.

Specified by:
unreferenced in interface java.rmi.server.Unreferenced

find

public int[] find(java.lang.String[] criteria)
           throws RecordNotFoundException
Description copied from interface: DatabaseNetworkServer
Returns an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria. Field n in the database file is described by criteria[n]. A null value in criteria[n] matches any field value. A non-null value in criteria[n] matches any field value that begins with criteria[n]. (For example, "Fred" matches "Fred" or "Freddy".)

Specified by:
find in interface DatabaseNetworkServer
Parameters:
criteria - The criteria against which to query the database.
Returns:
Array of record numbers which matched the criteria.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - If no records were found for the criteria.

lock

public void lock(int recNo)
          throws RecordNotFoundException
Description copied from interface: DatabaseNetworkServer
Locks a record so that it can only be updated or deleted by this client. If the specified record is already locked, the current thread gives up the CPU and consumes no CPU cycles until the record is unlocked.

Specified by:
lock in interface DatabaseNetworkServer
Parameters:
recNo - The record number of the record to lock.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - If the record could not be found.
